page.title: 05Tourism in NW Derby
page.content: Many people use Derby as a stepping stone to the Peak District and some- times look around Derby whilst they are in the area. Derby has some fine hotels such as the Friary and the Pennine. There are also some statues and monuments around town such as that of Michael Bass, a former MP. A beauty spot is the River Gardens near the Council House. People sometimes take photographs of Friargate Bridge, which was bought for Â£1 in 1984. Tourist attractions are also the modern aspects of Derby, such as the Assembly Rooms, which hosts films, concerts, exhibitions, sporting events, etc. The Market Place has exhibitions and political rallies are held there too. There are two museums: the Derby Museum attached to the Library and the Industrial Museum in the Old Silk Mill.
